adjective.description: Not guilty of a crime or offense.
examples: the arbitrary execution of an innocent man
he was innocent of any fraud

adjective.description: Not responsible for or directly involved in an event yet suffering its consequences.
Free from moral wrong; not corrupted.
Not intended to cause harm or offense; harmless.

noun.description: A pure, guileless, or naive person.
examples: she was an innocent compared with this man

noun.description: A person involved by chance in a situation, especially a victim of crime or war.
examples: they are prepared to kill or maim innocents in pursuit of a cause

origin: Middle English: from Old French, or from Latin innocent- not harming, from in- not + nocere to hurt.
